articles.author: David Cox
articles.title: From a tongue zapper to breathing classes I tried them all… so what finally stopped me snoring? - Daily Mail
articles.description: DAVID COX: Men, in particular, are far more likely to be loud sleepers because we have larger upper airways, amplifying any night-time noises.
articles.content: Every night, shortly after my girlfriend and I go to sleep, the peaceful calm of our one-bed flat is disturbed by a cacophony of restless rumblings. At least 15 million men and women in the UK are re… [+9668 chars]

articles.title: Nothing will rival Samsung this summer with a blockbuster Android upgrade - The Mirror
articles.description: Nothing will be back in a few months with the launch of its next-generation Android phone.
articles.content: Fledgling smartphone brand Nothing shook the Android market last year with an eye-catching device simply called the Phone (1). This low-cost call maker featured an impressive 6.55-inch display, decen… [+1962 chars]

articles.author: Ariana Garcia
articles.title: Why astronomers spotting a star eat planet is bad news for Earth - Chron
articles.description: For the first time ever, astronomers have discovered a star devouring its own planet. Earth may befall the same fate in the future.
articles.content: For the first time ever, a group of scientists caught a sun-like star devouring a planet. Unfortunately, the discovery may also foreshadow Earth's fate in about five billion years. In a study publish… [+3590 chars]
